Its fun but its very hard its a rage game im not ganna lie

Lovely paper art style with relaxing music backdrop a game where milliseconds make the difference between success and horrible jet pack crash. And you will crash. Repeatedly. Because gravity, momentum, and the frailness of the human body are your greatest adversaries, not to mention the how off-balance you are. The simple two-thumb controls are as intuitive as your pack is unwieldy, and the game pushes you to fly through a series of timed challenges that steadily but fairly increase in difficulty through the campaign. After each failure, you can retry instantly, and the cycle of repeated attempts lulls you into a zen-like state as you slowly improve. This is a game that is difficult to learn and perhaps impossible to master, but easy to keep playing after each failure, because you know you need just one more chance. Or two. Or fifty.
I had a lot of fun but it’s a little hard to control but that’s it

This game isn’t necessarily a bad game a like to play it a lot. It’s just some things that need fixing, for example the birds in the pier there is way to many birds and the hit your character causing some wierd movements. Also, sometimes the water and above cloud missions will be wierd because I clip the water and clip above the clouds and it won’t give me the check.So this game is really good but just need some minor fixes.

title.label: Great if you take the time

content.label:
Like most games, you get better the more you play and practice. This is no different. However the beginning is really frustrating and tough to gauge how to even fly at all. If you stick with it, though, it’s very rewarding and has very attainable missions, and a second, harder game mode that is also super fun once you really know how to maneuver your guy. I played this for about 5 hours over 3 days and beat it 100%. 
Absolutely recommend.
One word :Trash

The birds! The birds!  This game is plenty difficult without the kamikaze birds. By the third area the quarters are pretty tight and the maneuvers are fairly difficult; the birds are a random and unnecessary element to this game. In short: Piloteer is a challenging game with great physics; except the birds.

Bad graphics, terrible game play controls.   

DELETE!

Could be lots of fun - I've spent hours with this game.  Unfortunately, the controls probably match how a real life jet pack would operate.  Very difficult and completely unforgiving. Maybe if you could fire the up/down and right left jets individually it might work.  As is - I spent 10 minutes on each learning task and every success was complete luck.

This looks like a quirky tongue in cheek take on flying games similar to QWOP. However it feels incredibly frustrating to play and incomplete. There are only two options--fly up and left or down and right, so there's no precision. The game also feels empty and unfinished--there isn't any interaction with the environment or funny animations that could make failing fun.

After playing for five minutes I'm somehow locked out of the basic missions -the meat of the game-and can't seem to find them.

+1 star for the design, concept and having a black female protagonist (nice to see that in a game) 
Zero stars for gameplay and the actual experience.
Great game, the hard missions and challenging controls just make it more addicting. I also love the crayonny graphics. I just wish it had more missions and much larger world

It seemed like a nice environmental effect when first I noticed the birds. However by the 3rd area there are 10+ birds on screen at any time and colliding with them produces physics so unpredictable you would swear they're procedurally generated. The game comes across as an unholy combination of Lunar Lander and Happy Wheels. Still there's something charming about it I didn't totally hate it. I'm still stuck on the very last land on everything mission b/c birds. 
Update: birds were addressed score upgraded.
I love rag doll and also super hard games.  Get it!

When you play for the first time it is a little difficult to get use to the controls, but once you get use to you'll definitely love the game and the challenges!! They are really fun and really addictive!!
Fun, funky, cool game. Interesting to see where this goes.
I love this app! It is so much fun to play the missions, which are frustrating, but keep you going. I also love how you can swap controls if it is too hard to fly.

I want more levels! Please! This game deserves to last more months rather than just weeks. I would play probably 30 mins a day during my lunch break. I have enjoyed how challenging this game can be and i love how developers are listening to the reviews. Thank you for lessening the annoying seagulls. Let's have this game bloom even more by creating more levels and challenges!
lol I wouldn't yell at you for making too hard of a game at all! It's exciting and pretty intense at the later levels. I'd love to see what comes next!

There's something about the aesthetics and music in this game that doesn't have any equivalents elsewhere. It's one of two games that I always show to my friends whenever I wanna convey the message that i have peculiar tastes. It's just delightfully different.
This game is great for a $1! It's a fun challenge, don't expect to live every time because you won't!😆

The game is hard as anything, but very rewarding when you beat each goal. It's kind of like QWOP with flying. It's great. Play it.

This game is awesome! I know there are some people out there that say that the controls are hard, or that there are too many birds, but I personally think it is fine. Those people who hate the game are rage quitters. They give up, just because they can't beat a level within five tries. I do not recommend this game to people who rage quit a lot. If you don't know what rage quit means, it means pretty much what I just said. It is someone who quits a game because he gets mad from not being able to do something. Now  , getting back on topic, this game is sort of a free roam, to an extent. You can go anywhere you want within the given boundaries. There are three maps that you unlock by completing levels. The controls are a bit tricky, but you will get used to them. Pretty much all you do is fly around with your jet pack and complete missions. Apparently your character is a girl but it doesn't make a difference to me. I still love the game. In conclusion, I love this game, and I highly recommend you to get it.

title.label: Awesome game to pass the time!

content.label: I agree with the other 5 star reviews. Not sure what's up with the hate but this game is very fun. The controls take some getting used to and the graphics are phenomenal!

Why is this game getting so much hate. I had it and played through it and it was amazing. Everyone complaining about the controls just needs to take more time on it and get the hang of it once you do you will have an amazing time doing flips and doing crazy things. Great game!

The incessant attack from seagulls in the third area leave you feeling cheated by the game. You spend your time in the first two areas mastering flight then it's all for nothing in the third area when Kamikaze seagulls constantly nose dive into you, throwing off your flight path, causing you to crash. Very annoying and contrary to the entire premise of the game, which is mastering flight with a jet pack.
Don't waste your time or money.....deleted after 5 minutes

title.label: Super hard but once u get the hang it's fun

content.label: I like this game. It reminds me of the frustrations of playing old-school games. It's not easy but that's what's appealing, not everything has to be easy to be fun. Cheers.
Controls are confusing do not download this game
10/10 it has weird controls and one could even go as far as to say unpredictable making it extremely hard. I love it!

This game is tough. You may see a lot of people complain about the controls, but they are not a problem. Play for about an hour and you will get the hang of them. Soon you will be amazed that you can complete missions you thought were impossible. My main complaint is that in a game with so many difficult challenges, the physics aren't always consistent. If you need to land on 20 objects in 30 seconds, you need to touch and go. Sometimes the touch will count, sometimes it won't. Other times you will get stuck to the object and blast off in the wrong direction entirely. Very frustrating. The game itself is quite good and was clearly designed to be difficult. The developer should know how many times I've cursed his name while playing this. More content would be great. I'm currently at rank Platinum Aviator!
